## Discussion

You can find an entity by name in a scene by calling the scene’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Scene/findEntity(named:)] method. Or you can recursively search among the children of a given entity by calling the entity’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Entity/findEntity(named:)] method.

Entity names are not guaranteed to be unique. When you search by name, these methods return the first entity encountered with the given name.

# name

**Instance Property**

The name of the entity.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor @preconcurrency var name: String { get set }
```

## Discussion

You can find an entity by name in a scene by calling the scene’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Scene/findEntity(named:)] method. Or you can recursively search among the children of a given entity by calling the entity’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Entity/findEntity(named:)] method.

Entity names are not guaranteed to be unique. When you search by name, these methods return the first entity encountered with the given name.

## Inspecting an entity

- **scene**: The scene that owns the entity.
- **findEntity(named:)**: Recursively searches all descendant entities for one with the given name.
- **debugDescription**: A human readable description of the entity.
